header.name: chaos/preprocessor/control/if.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro that acts as an "if-else" construct.

macro.abstract: The macro expands to one of two alternatives depending on its first argument.

usage.param: The condition that determines whether the macro expands to t or __VA_ARGS__. Valid values range from 0 to .
The resulting expression if cond is non-zero.
The resulting expression if cond is 0.
The condition that determines whether the macro expands to t or f. Valid values range from 0 to .
The resulting expression if cond is non-zero.
The resulting expression if cond is 0.

macro.para: If cond expands to 0, this macro expands to f or __VA_ARGS__. Otherwise, it expands to t.
This macro performs a Boolean conversion of cond. If this conversion is not desirable, may be used instead.
This macro is lazy. If cond is non-zero, only t is evaluated. Likewise, if cond is 0, only f (or __VA_ARGS__) is evaluated.
